page.title: 01FARMLAND IN SOUTH EAST DEVON
page.content: This is an area of mainly grassland farming, containing flocks of sheep and several dairy herds with about a quarter of the land devoted to arable crops, mostly cereals. It is in a popular holiday area which is dotted with permanent and touring caravan sites. The north east corner is partly covered with indigenous trees together with a few sections of cultivated forestry fir plantations. The south west corner is the only residential area - some of which is geared to the influx of visitors during the holiday period - mainly accommodation in guest houses. It is a peaceful, rural area - the higher points affording glorious views of the surrounding countryside with vistas extending to Lyme Bay. A few people are engaged in agriculture - but most work in nearby towns.
